card.description: A dataset of test results for heart disease patients, used to predict whether or not someone may have heart disease.

context.potentialUses: Diagnose whether someone may be at risk for heart disease based on various factors.

Resting Blood Pressure.description: Whether they have chest pain, and if so whether it is anginal: a feeling like your heart is being squeezed.

Fasting Blood Sugar > 120mg/dl.description: Whether or not their fasting blood sugar is high (above 120).

Resting ECG Results.description: The results of an echycardiogram: whether there are abnormalities detected in their heart.

Maximum Heart Rate Achieved.description: During an exercise test, the highest the patient's heart rate reached.

Exercise Induced Angina.description: Whether or not exercise induced angina in the patient

ST Depression Induced By Exercise Relati.id: ST Depression Induced By Exercise Relative To Rest
ST Depression Induced By Exercise Relati.description: The rate of ST depression (artery issues) caused by exercise, an indicator of heart issues.

Slope of Peak Exercise ST Segment.id: Slope of Peak Exercise ST Segment
Slope of Peak Exercise ST Segment.description: The slope of their ST segment (the artery being measured) during exercise.

Number of Major Vessels Colored by Flour.id: Number of Major Vessels Colored by Flourosopy
Number of Major Vessels Colored by Flour.description: Fluoroscopy is a process of mapping arteries to the heart: this shows how many blood vessels were highly visible in the process. A low or high number may correspond to heart disease.

Diagnosis of Heart Disease.description: Whether or not the patient has heart disease.
